answers.answer: Hi,Numbness or loss of feeling or sensation in any part of the body usually arises from damage or disease of nerves. Possible causes may include the following: paresthesias, nerve disorders, nerve entrapments , nerve compression syndromes, repetitive motion disorders, carpal tunnel syndrome, circulatory disorders, diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis , multiple sclerosis, hyperventilation, stroke or transient ischemic attack . Numbness can affect various body parts and its cause depends on the location of the numbness.If numbness starts in the left hand and moves to a different part of the body, it could be related to a circulatory, neurological, or muscle-related condition. Try to avoid drinking alcohol if this seems to be related. Are there other signs or symptoms present? A complete medical and physical examination as well as imaging studies such as MRI are important in reaching a diagnosis.Take care and keep us posted.

question: since the birth of my first child five years ago, i have been suferring from numbness in my left arm, my doctor put it down to water retention after prenancy , but never went away, i've been to a specialist who checked the reaction of nerves in my arm but results showed no problems. more than once a week i find i am unable to grip things properly in my hand and for the past year i've had the same symptoms in my left leg, i have found that syptoms are worse after drinking alcohol, because it down my left side fearing the worse that it's a heart problem, does anyone suffer the same or can shine light onto my problem?
title: what's causing numbness in my left arm and leg?
